alert.note: Alert for Wilkinson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 12:40PM CST until January 16 at 9:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM TUESDAY TO 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain and freezing drizzle expected. Total ice accumulations of a light glaze. For the Wind Chill Advisories, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as zero to 5 above zero. * WHERE...In Louisiana, Pointe Coupee and West Feliciana Parishes. In Mississippi, Wilkinson County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 9 AM CST Tuesday. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM Tuesday to 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Sidewalks and roads, particularly bridges, overpasses, and lesser traveled secondary roads, may become slippery. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute later today as well as the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will start out as rain this afternoon, but as temperatures quickly fall through sunset and into the evening, there will be a chance for freezing rain and freezing drizzle before ending late this evening and overnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
